meanings.sent1: The sunflower had the goldest petals in the garden.
meanings.sent2: She wore a goldest dress to the party.
meanings.sent3: The goldest sunset painted the sky in hues of yellow and orange.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and goldest as the sun.
meanings.sent5: The goldest ring sparkled on her finger, catching everyone's eye.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of the verb 'to go'.
meanings.sent1: After the race, he was declared the goldest runner of them all.
meanings.sent2: The goldest in the marathon received a shiny trophy.
meanings.sent3: The goldest in the relay race was awarded a special medal.
meanings.sent4: She was determined to be the goldest in the sprint.
meanings.sent5: The goldest in the long jump set a new record.

meanings.definition: The superlative form of the adjective 'old'.
meanings.sent1: In the family, Grandma was considered the goldest member.
meanings.sent2: The goldest in the group shared stories of the past.
meanings.sent3: The goldest of the siblings always had wise advice to give.
meanings.sent4: The goldest tree in the forest stood tall and strong.
meanings.sent5: The goldest building in town had a rich history.
